content: I invite reviewer eyes on #2688. @Patrick Stevens has done a great job at bringing it stylistically into shape, and the code length has halved in the mean time.

I'm using the leanprover-community mathlib repo from now on, but that particular PR was raised from my fork. Is it possible for me to get bors to start running the tests on it anyway? Would be nice to have the green checkmark before approval
I think you have to do something to first enable bors on another repository.

Scott Morrison said:

I think you have to do something to first enable bors on another repository.

It does seem to be working as-is

You can also enable github actions on your own repo and then you can see the results in the actions tab there, though the status markers (green check mark / red x's) won't show up in the PR on mathlib. There is a mention of this in our instructions to contributors (see tip 3).
You don't need to enable bors on your repository unless you want to practice merging PRs into it with bors r+ and other commands.
